rev.comment: Virtual PC is dead, only "Windows XP mode" exists, but is not really useful to mount ISOs
rev.diff:
Line 76: Line 76:
After mounting the live CD's filesystem, software on the live CD can be run directly (I.e., without booting) by [[chroot]]ing into the live CD's mounted filesystem.
After mounting the live CD's filesystem, software on the live CD can be run directly (I.e., without booting) by [[chroot]]ing into the live CD's mounted filesystem.
â
A live CD ISO image can also be mounted by a [[Virtual Machine]] such as [[VirtualBox]], [[VMware Workstation]] and [[Windows_Virtual_PC]] or can be converted to a [[Live USB]] using [[SYSLINUX]]. Tools such as [[UNetbootin]] can automate this process.
+
A live CD ISO image can also be mounted by a [[Virtual Machine]] such as [[VirtualBox]] and [[VMware Workstation]] or can be converted to a [[Live USB]] using [[SYSLINUX]]. Tools such as [[UNetbootin]] can automate this process.
